content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Station at (-14.0, -15.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (x=24.0, y=-15.0)
- Wooden chest (x=23.5, y=-16.5) containing 301 coal

### Iron Ore Processing System at (-14.0, 23.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (x=-14.0, y=23.0) mining iron ore
- Wooden chest (x=-14.5, y=21.5) storing 367 iron ore
- Two stone furnaces (x=-11.0, y=20.0 and x=-9.0, y=20.0) for smelting

### Copper Ore Processing System at (20.0, 20.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (x=20.0, y=20.0) mining copper ore
- Input wooden chest (x=20.5, y=21.5) storing 413 copper ore
- Secondary input wooden chest (x=22.5, y=21.5) storing 369 copper ore
- Stone furnace (x=24.0, y=20.0) for smelting
- Output wooden chest (x=24.5, y=17.5) storing 53 copper plates
- Burner inserter (x=24.5, y=18.5) moving items from furnace to output chest
- Burner inserter (x=22.5, y=20.5) moving items from input chest to furnace

ERROR TIPS

### Furnace Fuel Management Issues
- Check furnace fuel capacity before attempting to insert more fuel
- The furnace at x=24.0, y=20.0 has reached its maximum fuel capacity (50/50 coal)

### Mining System Maintenance
- Monitor fuel levels in burner mining drills to prevent work stoppage
- The coal mining drill at x=24.0, y=-15.0 has run out of fuel and needs refueling

### General System Design
- Ensure proper positioning of inserters relative to their source and destination entities
- Verify that all components in processing chains (mining drill → chest → inserter → furnace) are properly aligned and configured
